result.execSummary:
The defendant Torry D Putzke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Court orders the restitution to be paid to the probation officer.
-Court orders the court costs be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.

-Court Costs are to be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.
-Defendant is to re-pay the Discovery fees of $297.75.
-Defendant is to re-pay the costs for Court Appointed Attorney. TO BE DETERMINED.  On October 24, 2017 the Court amends the JOC to reflect the Court Appointed Attorney Fees of $798.00 less the $400 on file, for a balance of $398.00.

-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

-Court will review each year to see if restitution is being paid and if not, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.

timeConds.notes: Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.

records.addlTxt: Discharge Regular - 09/13/2022

Letter to Judge Slate from Agent Ryan Helmuth dated 06/15/2022 re: restitution has been paid in full.

Balance Inquiry

10:16 AM Defendant Torry D Putzke appeared in court, Agent Seth Feldner appeared via zoom. REVIEW - Court goes over restitution due. Statement by defendant - hopes to have it paid off in the next month or so. Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year. Statement by Agent Feldner - this is a yearly review. Statement by the Court - confirms, this hearing is just a review. No extension at this time.

Court adjourned at 10:19 AM
Probation review hearing on September 7, 2021 at 10:00 am.

9:08 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Ryan Helmuth not present in court.  Court has received a letter stating the amount of restitution paid.  If paid off during the term of probation court will look at forgiving the court costs.  No PRH hearing next year.

Court adjourned at 9:09 a.m.
Letter from Agent Ryan Helmuth dated 09/13/2019 re: defendant's financial obligations and not able to attend PRH on 09/16.
Probation review hearing on September 16, 2019 at 09:00 am.

1:23 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Ryan Helmuth present in court.  Court questions defendant regarding payment of restitution.  Statement by defendant - has been making payments and plans on using the divorce settlement, but is not sure how that is going to be paid.  Statement by the Court.

Court adjourned at 1:25 p.m.
Probation review hearing on October 15, 2018 at 01:00 pm.
Inmate Request to the Court
Inmate Request to the Court

Defendant phoned the office and inquired about an inmate request form due to a time sensitive family emergency. Defendant was informed that she would need to have an inmate request form submitted through the jail and our office would do our best to have the Court review it as soon as possible.

Proposed Stipulation & Recommendation from Atty Robert Barrington

9:48 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Curtis Julka.  Robert Barrington as SpecialProsecutor for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Julka has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  Statement by Father David Greenfield.  State confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Statement by Atty Barrington.  Statement by Atty Julka.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 5 years.

CONDITIONS:  

-1 year county jail.  Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
-Court costs.  To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.
-Restitution - $25,918.06 ($3,000.00 & $22,918.06) To be paid to the probation officer.
-40 hours of community service
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to re-pay the costs for Court appointed attorney and Discovery fees as a condition of probation.

Court will review each year to see if restitution is being paid and if not, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.

Statement by the Court in regards to the request for court appointed counsel.  Court questions defendant if she has contacted the PD's office and if she has tried hiring an attorney on her own.  Statement by defendant, does not qualify for PD representation and the paperwork for divorce will be filed soon.  Court questions defendant regarding payment towards court appointed counsel.  Statement by defendant, can pay $100 per month.  Court will set for Status Hearing on May 15, 2017 at 9:30 a.m.  If the divorce paperwork is filed, the court will appoint counsel and defendant is to pay $100 per month commencing the end of May and every month thereafter for court appointed counsel.

records.addlTxt: to Withdraw

10:12 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Wendy Patrickus via telephone.  Robert Barrington for the State of Wisconsin via telephone.  Statement by Atty Patrickus, filed a motion to withdraw late friday and requests to withdraw from the case.  Statement by the Court.  Statement by defendant - was notified late of the request to withdraw.  Defendant has no objection to Atty Patrickus withdrawing from the case.  Statement by Atty Barrington.  Statement by the Court - will grant the motion to withdraw and Atty Patrickus is to submit an order.  Court goes over the right to counsel and how to obtain counsel.  Court sets for review in 2 weeks.  If no counsel, court will set hearing.

Court adjourned at 10:16 a.m.

to Withdraw as Counsel 

(Per Judge, will be heard on 03/27 instead of the sentencing)
Sentencing hearing on March 27, 2017 at 10:00 am.

2:53 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Wendy Patrickus.  Robert Barrington as Special Prosecutor for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to one count of Theft and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Patrickus concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a presentence investigation be conducted and filed with the court in 60 days.  Court sets for Sentencing on - March 27, 2017 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:59 p.m.
